BIAS.Definition: an unfair personal opinion that influences your judgment

TENDENCY.Definition: if someone has a tendency to do or like something, they will probably do it or like it

INACTION.Definition: failure to do anything that might provide a solution to a problem

EVIDENCE.Definition: one or more reasons for believing that something is or is not true

HELPLESS.Definition: unable to do anything to help yourself or anyone else

IMPULSIVE.Definition: showing behavior in which you do things suddenly without any planning and without considering the effects they may have

MERGE.Definition: to combine or join together, or to cause things to do this

HONK.Definition: if a goose or a car horn honks, it makes a short, loud sound

COMPELS.Definition: to produce a strong feeling or reaction

PART.Definition: to separate or cause something or someone to separate

CUT OFF.Definition: to suddenly move your car sideways in front of another car that was in front of you, leaving too little space

EXCESSIVELY.Definition: in a way that is too much

DETAINED.Definition: to force someone officially to stay in a place

REENACT.Definition: to repeat the actions of an event that happened in the past as a hobby or as a performance

INCIDENT.Definition: an event that is either unpleasant or unusual

ALLEGED.Definition: said or thought by some people to be the stated bad or illegal thing, although you have no proof

AGGRESSOR.Definition: a person or country that starts an argument, fight, or war by attacking first

LIGHT.Definition: a particular appearance presented to view

INJUSTICE.Definition: (an example of) a situation in which there is no fairness and justice

ILLOGICAL.Definition: not reasonable, wise, or practical, usually because directed by the emotions rather than by careful thought

HASHTAG.Definition: a word or phrase preceded by the symbol # that classifies or categorizes the accompanying text (such as a tweet)

EXPLOITED.Definition: to use someone or something unfairly for your own advantage

APPLAUSE.Definition: the sound of people clapping their hands repeatedly to show enjoyment or approval of something such as a performance or speech

COGNITIVE BIAS.Definition: the way a particular person understands events, facts, and other people, which is based on their own particular set of beliefs and experiences and may not be reasonable or accurate

PASSED DOWN.Definition: to teach or give something to someone who will be alive after you have died

STARVATION.Definition: the state of having no food for a long period, often causing death

PREDATORS.Definition: an animal that hunts, kills, and eats other animals

TACTIC.Definition: a planned way of doing something

REINFORCES.Definition: if something reinforces an idea or opinion, it provides more proof or support for it and makes it seem true

HARASSED.Definition: to continue to annoy or upset someone over a period of time

STEPS IN.Definition: to become involved in a difficult situation or argument in order to help find a solution

SHAMEFUL.Definition: deserving blame, or being a reason for feeling ashamed

COWARDS.Definition: a person who is not brave and is too eager to avoid danger, difficulty, or pain

FAVORED.Definition: to support or prefer one particular possibility

IGNORED.Definition: to intentionally not listen or give attention to

CHANT.Definition: to repeat or sing a word or phrase continuously

BUM.Definition: someone who has no home or job and lives by asking other people for money

UTILITY.Definition: he usefulness of something, especially in a practical way

INTERNALIZE.Definition: to accept or absorb an idea, opinion, belief, etc. so that it becomes part of your character

POSED.Definition: to ask a question, especially in a formal situation such as a meeting

IMPLYING.Definition: to communicate an idea or feeling without saying it directly

CONTENT.Definition: pleased with your situation and not hoping for change or improvement

STILL.Definition: staying in the same position; not moving

PART.Definition: some but not all of a thing

NATURE.Definition: the character of a person, or the characteristics a person is born with

NURTURE.Definition: the way in which children are treated as they are growing, especially as compared with the characteristics they are born with

EQUATE.Definition: to consider one thing to be the same as or equal to another thing

TAKING THE SITUATION INTO OUR OWN HANDS.Definition: to take control of something : seek to do something that is the responsibility of others

RUSH HOUR.Definition: the busy part of the day when towns and cities are crowded, either in the morning when people are travelling to work, or in the evening when people are travelling home

OUTSMART.Definition: to obtain an advantage over someone by using your intelligence and often by using a trick; to outwit

INDECISION.Definition: the state of being unable to make a choice

DESPERATE.Definition: needing or wanting something very much

FAULTY.Definition: not working correctly, or not correct

OVERCOME.Definition: to defeat or succeed in controlling or dealing with something

CULTIVATE.Definition: to try to develop and improve something

DEEP DOWN.Definition: in the part of your mind where your strongest and often most secret feelings are

SUBCONSCIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that uses or relates to the subconscious (= the part of your mind that notices and remembers information when you are not actively trying to do so, and influences your behaviour even though you do not realize it)

NEWFOUND.Definition: only recently happening, discovered, or beginning to exist

MONITOR.Definition: to watch and check a situation carefully for a period of time in order to discover something about it

GLORIFY.Definition: to describe or represent something in a way that makes it seem better or more important than it really is

DECISIVE.Definition: able to make decisions quickly and confidently, or showing this quality

OUTCOMES.Definition: a result or effect of an action, situation, etc.
